alert.note: Alert for Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 9:11PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Wallace County through 845 PM MDT... At 810 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northwest of Weskan, or 14 miles west of Sharon Springs, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Weskan around 825 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central Colorado. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for west central Kansas.
